LayoutNode.Content: 1-5 of 43 reviews Camera is awful (yellow or grainy photos)
LayoutNode.SRC:
1-5 of 43 reviews
Camera is awful (yellow or grainy photos)

LayoutNode.Content: I had a Moto G Play that I loved, but it started shutting off when the battery hit 30-40%. So Ichose the E4 to replace it and boy am I regretting it. I will say that the phone works well ingeneral, hence the 2 stars instead of 1. My huge issue is with the camera. It sucks. I don't thinkthere's a better way to word it. It just really really sucks. With the flash, photos are either veryyellow or the lighting is just all kinds of wrong. Without the flash, photos (not in low light) aregrainy and again, the lighting is terrible. If I'm lucky and get just the right amount of naturallight, the photos are fine. I take a lot of photos...most of which are trash since I've switched tothis phone. I did not have this problem with my last one. I don't require perfection, but I would atleast like to not have to trash every photo I attempt to take. I was always very impressed withthe Moto G Play's camera for such a reasonably priced phone. This one, I would love to returnand replace with someone else. See more
LayoutNode.SRC:
I had a Moto G Play that I loved, but it started shutting off when the battery hit 30-40%. So I chose the E4 to replace it and boy am I regretting it. I will say that the phone works well in general, hence the 2 stars instead of 1. My huge issue is with the camera. It sucks. I don't think there's a better way to word it. It just really really sucks. With the flash, photos are either very yellow or the lighting is just all kinds of wrong. Without the flash, photos (not in low light) are grainy and again, the lighting is terrible. If I'm lucky and get just the right amount of natural light, the photos are fine. I take a lot of photos...most of which are trash since I've switched to this phone. I did not have this problem with my last one. I don't require perfection, but I would at least like to not have to trash every photo I attempt to take. I was always very impressed with the Moto G Play's camera for such a reasonably priced phone. This one, I would love to return and replace with someone else.
See more

LayoutNode.Content: Hello SAPJ. I am sorry for the inconveniences, but I will be happy to assist you with that. You can check thislink on how to use the camera properly: http://bit.ly/2KD95Pu - Marvin

LayoutNode.Content: The battery life of the device is next to pitiful. It will take 8 hours for it to fully charge and by 4.5hours the battery run completely dead. As for the hardware it runs as to be expected, but thewhole casing and exterior of the phone is less than impressive. I would rather go back to theMoto G-play I had than give this overpriced paperweight a good review. The E4 has a terribletendency to overheat if it is laid down for a minute. Even when charging you'd think the deviceis ready to catch fire. I almost hesitate placing the phone in my pocket for fear of the thoughtthat it might overheat just sitting in my pocket at work. The only positive this E4 has over my oldG-play is that this has fingerprint unlock to it. Makes unlocking the phone way easier andfaster. Still I wouldn't recommend this phone to anyone over the Moto G-play. By the way, theyphone is Black NOT Silver. The label lied. See more
LayoutNode.SRC:
The battery life of the device is next to pitiful. It will take 8 hours for it to fully charge and by 4.5 hours the battery run completely dead. As for the hardware it runs as to be expected, but the whole casing and exterior of the phone is less than impressive. I would rather go back to the Moto G-play I had than give this overpriced paperweight a good review. The E4 has a terrible tendency to overheat if it is laid down for a minute. Even when charging you'd think the device is ready to catch fire. I almost hesitate placing the phone in my pocket for fear of the thought that it might overheat just sitting in my pocket at work. The only positive this E4 has over my old G-play is that this has fingerprint unlock to it. Makes unlocking the phone way easier and faster. Still I wouldn't recommend this phone to anyone over the Moto G-play. By the way, they phone is Black NOT Silver. The label lied.
See more
32

LayoutNode.Content:
Hello Luke,

I am sorry for the inconveniences, but I will be happy to assist you with that. We suggestyou checking this link http://bit.ly/2rPAh2c you would find some useful tips in case the device is not chargingproperly and why it is charging slowly. Heat is a normal result of using power on the phone. The phone hasbuilt-in safety factors to keep it from getting dangerously hot. It will shut down if that is in any danger ofhappening. You may also check this link: http://lnv.gy/2iG3fe3 We tried to illustrate why a warm or even a hotphone is not necessarily a cause of alarm. - Marvin See more
LayoutNode.SRC:
Hello Luke,<br /><br />I am sorry for the inconveniences, but I will be happy to assist you with that. We suggest you checking this link http://bit.ly/2rPAh2c you would find some useful tips in case the device is not charging properly and why it is charging slowly. Heat is a normal result of using power on the phone. The phone has built-in safety factors to keep it from getting dangerously hot. It will shut down if that is in any danger of happening. You may also check this link: http://lnv.gy/2iG3fe3 We tried to illustrate why a warm or even a hot phone is not necessarily a cause of alarm. - Marvin
See more

LayoutNode.Content: I love this phone. I got a great deal on it at my local walmart at the price of $49. I wasn'texpecting much but it has wowed me. I had a HTC which was my favorite but it completelycrashed. I am happy to say this one had exceeded my expectations at a great price and greatphone. 5 stars for sure See more
LayoutNode.SRC:
I love this phone. I got a great deal on it at my local walmart at the price of $49. I wasn't expecting much but it has wowed me. I had a HTC which was my favorite but it completely crashed. I am happy to say this one had exceeded my expectations at a great price and great phone. 5 stars for sure

LayoutNode.Content: Good Value. Lots of features for a budget phone!
LayoutNode.SRC: Good Value. Lots of features for a budget phone!

LayoutNode.Content: I bought this phone in a local Walmart for $49 in June. During the first 2 weeks I was frustratedand missed my Samsung Gusto 3 flip phone, but eventually learned how to do everything Ineed with ease. I've used it to talk, text, read emails, keep a calendar, and for turn by turndirections (with voice) when traveling. The maps are great when you need to find storesrestaurants and hotels in an unfamiliar place. I watched a few YouTube videos on it, but I prefera larger screen, so I use my Chromebook. I haven't used the camera yet, so I can't rate it. Themain complaint I have is that the screen is difficult to see in sunlight. I am very satisfied with mypurchase, so I'll give it a 5 star rating. If I paid $200 for it, maybe I'd only give it 4 stars, but itworks better than expected. See more
LayoutNode.SRC:
I bought this phone in a local Walmart for $49 in June. During the first 2 weeks I was frustrated and missed my Samsung Gusto 3 flip phone, but eventually learned how to do everything I need with ease. I've used it to talk, text, read emails, keep a calendar, and for turn by turn directions (with voice) when traveling. The maps are great when you need to find stores restaurants and hotels in an unfamiliar place. I watched a few YouTube videos on it, but I prefer a larger screen, so I use my Chromebook. I haven't used the camera yet, so I can't rate it. The main complaint I have is that the screen is difficult to see in sunlight. I am very satisfied with my purchase, so I'll give it a 5 star rating. If I paid $200 for it, maybe I'd only give it 4 stars, but it works better than expected.
See more
00

LayoutNode.Content: A Nougat smartphone for $40 that isn't laggy?!
LayoutNode.SRC: A Nougat smartphone for $40 that isn't laggy?!

LayoutNode.Content: I've had this phone a week now with no issues, it's just a really good phone. I obviously wasn'tgoing to expect miracles here but it's nonetheless the best deal out there. The specs arealready on here but here's the take-away: + 5" 720 HD IPS 2.5d screen + 8MP rear/5MP frontcamera w rear AND front LED flash + 4G LTE support, dual-band wifi, BT, and GPS + 1.4Ghzquadcore processor + 16GB memory, 2 GB RAM + Support for nano SIM and microsd +Android 7.1.1 "Nougat" + Fingerprint reader w/ one-button navigation + Front-facing speaker -Locked to Verizon prepaid Specs that are fitting for the price with some surprising extras likethe front LED flash, fingerprint reader, one button navigation, front speaker, and dual band.So...you get ALL THAT for $40 right now. BUY BUY BUY! See more
LayoutNode.SRC:
I've had this phone a week now with no issues, it's just a really good phone. I obviously wasn't going to expect miracles here but it's nonetheless the best deal out there. The specs are already on here but here's the take-away: + 5" 720 HD IPS 2.5d screen + 8MP rear/5MP front camera w rear AND front LED flash + 4G LTE support, dual-band wifi, BT, and GPS + 1.4Ghz quadcore processor + 16GB memory, 2 GB RAM + Support for nano SIM and microsd + Android 7.1.1 "Nougat" + Fingerprint reader w/ one-button navigation + Front-facing speaker - Locked to Verizon prepaid Specs that are fitting for the price with some surprising extras like the front LED flash, fingerprint reader, one button navigation, front speaker, and dual band. So...you get ALL THAT for $40 right now. BUY BUY BUY!
See more
